title: Innodisk expands edge AI applications and intelligent solution at Computex 2024 with new brand strategy
summary: Innodisk showcases new products at Computex 2024 focusing on edge AI, including memory expansion, SSDs, and camera technology for machine vision. Live demonstrations feature smart manufacturing solutions and people tracking to highlight edge AI capabilities. The company introduces a new brand strategy 'Architect Intelligence' at the event, emphasizing commitment to building intelligent solutions with global partners.
green_innovation: FALSE. While the article discusses innovative products related to AI technology, it does not explicitly mention how these contribute to environmental sustainability goals or reduce negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes Innodisk's introduction of new products at Computex 2024, showcasing a comprehensive range of products with a focus on edge AI. This represents business innovation as it introduces new or improved products to the market.
green_product: FALSE. Although the article mentions new products related to AI technology, it does not explicitly state how these products are designed, manufactured, or used to significantly reduce their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: FALSE. The article discusses technological advancements in AI-related products and solutions but does not focus on methods or techniques in manufacturing or operational activities that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 334310 - Audio and Video Equipment Manufacturing, 334411 - Electron Tube Manufacturing, 334416 - Capacitor, Resistor, Coil, Transformer, and Other Inductor Manufacturing, 335313 - Switchgear and Switchboard Apparatus Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. The article provides information about Innodisk's new products and solutions in the edge AI space without making misleading environmental claims. There are no indications of greenwashing tactics in this context.

title: Innodisk unveils edge AI applications and intelligent solution at Computex 2024 with new brand strategy
summary: Innodisk unveils edge AI applications and intelligent solution at Computex 2024 with a focus on edge AI, showcasing new products, including CXL 2.0 memory expansion, E3.S SSD, and MIPI over Type-C technology. The article highlights Innodisk's commitment to building intelligent solutions with global partners under the new brand vision 'Architect Intelligence'. Various edge AI solutions like smart manufacturing PPE recognition, intelligent people tracking, and innovative camera technologies are discussed for smart cities and industrial applications.
green_innovation: FALSE. The article focuses on AI technology and intelligent solutions at an industry event, which align more with technological advancements and business strategies rather than direct environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses new products and technologies introduced by Innodisk, showcasing a focus on edge AI applications and the company's commitment to building intelligent solutions.
green_product: FALSE. While the article mentions innovative products and technologies, the focus is more on AI applications and intelligent solutions rather than highlighting specific environmentally-friendly characteristics or life cycle sustainability impact.
green_process: FALSE. The article primarily highlights technological advancements in AI applications and edge computing, but it does not specifically mention processes that minimize environmental impacts or promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 334220 - Radio and Television Broadcasting and Wireless Communications Equipment Manufacturing, 334119 - Other Computer Peripheral Equipment Manufacturing, 541512 - Computer Systems Design Services, 541511 - Custom Computer Programming Services
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not contain any claims or indications of false or exaggerated environmental benefits related to products or practices, so it does not align with the definition of greenwashing.
